Subgraph of ‘artefact’
thesaurus(root = "artefact", outPlot = "collapsibleTree")


Reusability means interactivity and accessibility on the web. It also means reproductibility of results by sharing open datasets and functions

title: From thesaurus to semantic network
text:
Data Analysis




Interactive map of mines
d <- hash::hash()
d <- read_mines(d = d,
                df.path = "C:/Rprojects/itineRis/results/Coordinates-mines_Thomas Huet.xlsx")
map_leaflet(d = d,
            d.coords = "mines.coords",
            export.plot = T,
            out.plot = "map_sites.html",
            dirOut = "C:/Rprojects/itineRis/results/")



Interactive ternary plot to visualise the results of lead isotopic analysis
isotop_ternaryplot(df.isotop)





Reusability means interactivity and accessibility on the web. It also means reproductibility of results by sharing open datasets and functions

title: From thesaurus to semantic network
text:
Thesaurus

OpenThesoISO25964-1ISO25964-2




Bibracte has shown that the ISO 25964 standard for the management of thesauri is sufficiently flexible to describe the different “points of view” presiding over the elaboration of the specialised and evolving “micro-languages” of archaeologists











Opentheso is a multilingual, multi-paradigm thesaurus manager. Created in 2005. It supports poly-hierarchies in accordance with ISO25964 (25964-1 and 25964-2)

title: From thesaurus to semantic network
text:
RDF triple-store
To be hosted on  https://isidore.science/


The aim is to store the RDF triples in ISIDORE, the largest scientific open data project/platform in France with over 3,000 data sources
